pull.title: build: remove unneeded configure $*val setting
pull.body:
Setting these values has been redundant since autoconf ~2.60, and we
require 2.69. Should not change behaviour. Includes minor formatting
improvements.

secp256k1 also recently made the same change:
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1079.

events.body: The automatic setting works only for variables `enable_foo` ( `--enable-foo`)  or variables  `with_foo` (`--with-foo`). But some of the removed assignments assign to `use_foo` or `build_bitcoin_foo` variables.

> The automatic setting works only for variables enable_foo ( --enable-foo) or variables with_foo (--with-foo).

😅 Right. I guess we try should clean these up as well; given we currently use a mix of everything throughout configure.. Will update the changes.

>  Right. I guess we try should clean these up as well; given we currently use a mix of everything throughout configure.. Will update the changes.

Have done this now. The changes are too granular as-is, and can be split-out / squashed down, but this should better reflect what we want to accomplish.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#24958](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24958) (build: Fix macOS Apple M1 build with miniupnpc and libnatpmp. Again :) by hebasto)
* [#24798](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24798) ([POC] build: Hello Qt 6 by hebasto)
* [#24291](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24291) (build: Remove negated --enable-fuzz checks from build system by MarcoFalke)
* [#24051](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24051) (Bugfix: configure: bitcoin-{cli,tx,util} don't need UPnP, NAT-PMP, or ZMQ by luke-jr)
* [#22644](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22644) (Deprecate UPnP support, require 2.1 or later by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
